docs.text:
Welcome to JDash Docs


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name]  - Create a new project.  mkdocs serve  - Start the live-reloading docs server.  mkdocs build  - Build the documentation site.  mkdocs help  - Print this help message.

docs.text:
Getting Started


Quick Start


The aim of this article is to get you up and running with jdash in 5 minutes.


Step 1: Get a free api key


JDash cloud allows you to save and retrieve user data i.e. dashboards, layouts, dashlet configurations and positions.


To get a free api key use 
JDash Cloud


Step 2: Install JDash Client


bower install jdash




Step 3: Create a basic HTML page


!DOCTYPE html


html

    
head

        
meta charset=
utf-8

        
title
A Simple Page with CKEditor
/title

        
!-- Make sure the path to CKEditor is correct. --

        
script src=
../ckeditor.js
/script

    
/head

    
body

        
form

            
textarea name=
editor1
 id=
editor1
 rows=
10
 cols=
80

                This is my textarea to be replaced with CKEditor.
            
/textarea

            
script

                // Replace the 
textarea id=
editor1
 with a CKEditor
                // instance, using default configuration.
                CKEDITOR.replace( 'editor1' );
            
/script

        
/form

    
/body


/html





Step 4: Develop your first dashlet


Basic Concepts

docs.text:
!DOCTYPE html  html 
     head 
         meta charset= utf-8 
         title A Simple Page with CKEditor /title 
         !-- Make sure the path to CKEditor is correct. -- 
         script src= ../ckeditor.js /script 
     /head 
     body 
         form 
             textarea name= editor1  id= editor1  rows= 10  cols= 80 
                This is my textarea to be replaced with CKEditor.
             /textarea 
             script 
                // Replace the  textarea id= editor1  with a CKEditor
                // instance, using default configuration.
                CKEDITOR.replace( 'editor1' );
             /script 
         /form 
     /body  /html
